Hurricane Dorian is a slow-moving storm that could cause high winds and flooding in our region, leading to significant damage. Dominion Energy is prepared for significant impacts.

Customers across South Carolina, North Carolina and Virginia should be prepared for significant impacts and multi-day outages. Impacts have already begun in South Carolina and North Carolina and will spread into Virginia.

@LDice1019 Dang, not the bacon!! Pantops got hit hard--it's taking time for our crews to locate each damage location and then make repairs. Updates will come, but it may take awhile, which I know is tough to hear. Thanks for hanging in there with us in the meantime. We're coming!

@Smallchic That IS frustrating! We've had multiple summer storms roll through this season and make a mess for you guys. I'm sorry you're out again. Crossing my fingers that you're back on soon. I know our crews are working hard.
@jebyrne06 Sure thing! Wish I had more info, but I really appreciate you doing your best to be patient during this frustrating time. Thank you.

@jebyrne06 Ugh, that's tough to be in that situation, and I wish I knew so you could make plans for your mom. The flickering doesn't really tell us anything with an ETA. While the crews are out patrolling and assessing damage, our folks are working to reroute power as soon as we can!

@jebyrne06 Sounds like a tree branch is coming into contact with a power line. The flicker is the power line trying to "clear" the fault from the line, and power going out after is a safety feature, shutting down power because it senses something on the line. It helps prevent fires, etc.

@jebyrne06 Jennifer, y'all saw the brunt of the storm, and it was a mess! Sorry that you're out so long! We are doing our best to get around all the fallen tree limbs and wires to clean up the damage and get things back to normal for you.
@BSchenkkan88 Gotcha! Four hours feels like a long time if you're sitting in the dark :( We'll do our best to get your back to normal as soon as well can. Thanks for hanging in there with us.

@BSchenkkan88 Hey Ben, that was a strong storm, it's a mess out there. Check the outage map periodically--after crews can patrol the area and assess what's needed for repairs, updates will be available. It may take awhile, thanks for your patience.

@Smallchic I'm sorry it's taking so long. With the damage we are seeing, and having to maneuver around fallen trees and power lines in the dark, our crews have to be extra careful. I know it's frustrating! You're right about the fridge contents-that stinks! Freezer is good for 48 hours.

@Smallchic Oh no! Jeannine, don't toss anything yet--food can stay cold for several hours in a fridge that doesn't get opened. I'm sorry you're out of power and you're not seeing it on the map...are you seeing any outages in the vicinity? Your street's outage may be part of a larger one.
